<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vectorization, then decide based on the following criteria (increasing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// level of priority):</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Scalable vectorization is disabled if no preference is specified.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return true if the inner loop \\p Lp is uniform with regard to the outer loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// \\p OuterLp (i.e., if the outer loop is vectorized, all the vector lanes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// executing the inner loop will execute the same iterations). This check is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// very constrained for now but it will be relaxed in the future. \\p Lp is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// considered uniform if it meets all the following conditions:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   1) it has a canonical IV (starting from 0 and with stride 1),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   2) its latch terminator is a conditional branch and,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   3) its latch condition is a compare instruction whose operands are the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      canonical IV and an OuterLp invariant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This check doesn&#39;t take into account the uniformity of other conditions not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// related to the loop latch because they don&#39;t affect the loop uniformity.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NOTE: We decided to keep all these checks and its associated documentation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// together so that we can easily have a picture of the current supported loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// nests. However, some of the current checks don&#39;t depend on \\p OuterLp and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// would be redundantly executed for each \\p Lp if we invoked this function for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// different candidate outer loops. This is not the case for now because we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// don&#39;t currently have the infrastructure to evaluate multiple candidate outer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loops and \\p OuterLp will be a fixed parameter while we only support explicit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// outer loop vectorization. It&#39;s also very likely that these checks go away</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// before introducing the aforementioned infrastructure. However, if this is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the case, we should move the \\p OuterLp independent checks to a separate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function that is only executed once for each \\p Lp.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3eb7a9b091032d4d053727b7a578a97e"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3eb7a9b091032d4d053727b7a578a97e">isUniformLoop</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;Lp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;OuterLp) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a1230fd674d2609b96527fe65eaf40b1b">getLoopLatch</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Expected loop with a single latch.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If Lp is the outer loop, it&#39;s uniform by definition.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Lp == OuterLp)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(OuterLp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a04337b572d34ea413c35dbac5d75530b">contains</a>(Lp) &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;OuterLp must contain Lp.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a> = Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop/#ae731e6e33c2f2a9a6ebd1d51886ce534">getCanonicalInductionVariable</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;LV: Canonical IV not found.\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;Latch = Lp-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a1230fd674d2609b96527fe65eaf40b1b">getLoopLatch</a>();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Checks if a function is scalarizable according to the TLI, in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the sense that it should be vectorized and then expanded in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// multiple scalar calls. This is represented in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TLI via mappings that do not specify a vector name, as in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// following example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    const VecDesc VecIntrinsics&#91;&#93; = &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///      &#123;&quot;llvm.phx.abs.i32&quot;, &quot;&quot;, 4&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae641260d79a9242ccf378d9a7949fdc3"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae641260d79a9242ccf378d9a7949fdc3">isTLIScalarize</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &amp;TLI, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">CallInst</a> &amp;CI) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> ScalarName = CI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a2b1ae7cf1bafdd43d1fee4c6ad0a2913">getCalledFunction</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#adb5c319f5905c1d3ca9eb5df546388c5">getName</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Scalarize = TLI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo/#af2dc370c0f0b837f18b006c2d4b8b7cc">isFunctionVectorizable</a>(ScalarName);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check that all known VFs are not associated to a vector</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function, i.e. the vector name is emty.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As a last resort, coerce the PHI to a AddRec expression</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Find histogram operations that match high-level code in loops:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buckets&#91;indices&#91;i&#93;&#93;+=step;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It matches a pattern starting from \\p HSt, which Stores to the &#39;buckets&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// array the computed histogram. It uses a BinOp to sum all counts, storing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// them using a loop-variant index Load from the &#39;indices&#39; input array.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// On successful matches it updates the STATISTIC &#39;HistogramsDetected&#39;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// regardless of hardware support. When there is support, it additionally</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// stores the BinOp/Load pairs in \\p HistogramCounts, as well the pointers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// used to update histogram in \\p HistogramPtrs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adf87a16be872504ce4d0ab9714dc6217"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adf87a16be872504ce4d0ab9714dc6217">findHistogram</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storeinst">StoreInst</a> &#42;HSt, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;TheLoop,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a> &amp;PSE,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1868"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1869"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1870"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1871"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1872"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Okay! We&#39;ve done all the tests. If any have failed, return false. Otherwise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1873"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we can vectorize, and at this point we don&#39;t have any other mem analysis</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1874"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which may limit our maximum vectorization factor, so just return true with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1875"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// no restrictions.</span></CodeLine>
